subtitle: Hello as many of you know I've shared my own spiritual journey and part of that journey is
that i've said i was part of a Gnostic group for several years, now I understand that every time i
say that people are asking me "What is Gnosticism?" and every time it's asked i'm left in a somewhat
awkward position because there's no simple answer really and so even though in this video i won't
be able to give you the complete reality, i can certainly give you a sense of what it's all about
and give you the pure meaning of what "Gnosis" is if you're looking for a clear definition of
what "Gnosticism" is or what "Gnosis" is and you want to categorize it and relate it to certain books
periods of time in history link it to certain groups of people, religions, or beliefs then
you're looking in the wrong direction if you want to understand the meaning of "gnosis" in a pure way
if you want to understand the spirit of gnosis and how you can invoke your own inner gnosis in your
own life you see if you believe gnosticism is a religion with a certain set of beliefs you may say
"i know what gnosticism is" but you don't you're just like someone peering into a shop window
looking at some candy and saying "i know that candy" but you don't because you haven't tasted it
moreover gnosticism is quite the opposite of what we conventionally understand as "religion" and
most gnostics throughout antiquity rebelled against the most organized religion; not because
they didn't believe in them or because they were just tyrants but because they understood
the teachings of religions in completely different ways and they understood religion in a different
way because they had this sort of "Gnosis-consciousness" you could call it and it's this
wisdom and purity of "Gnosis-consciousness" that i want to talk about because that's what really
matters when we're talking about gnosticism, so i am going to avoid arguing about the validity and
links to such texts as the Nag Hamadi, Pistis Sophia, Hermetica, Kybalion, Book of Enoch, Tablets
of Thoth ~ all sublime deeply gnostic and beautiful texts by the way i recommend
to study them all; perhaps on future videos if you're interested i will cover such books feel
free to let me know what you're interested in but the point is gnostics are those who
attain a high level or a high degree of gnosis and therefore they can recognize it within themselves
and others and in text no matter what the time in history or whatever text we're talking about
because they attained gnosis they can understand the direct truth of any spiritual teaching or any
religious teaching, the history of gnosticism is completely mysterious ethereal and it's difficult
to find solid sources on them because they were also secretive and there were many different
sects and groups and it wasn't their choice to be completely secretive, they swore to secrecy because
they saw and understood the state of the world and if they were to speak of what they knew or worse
interpreted teachings of jesus for example much differently to christianity then they would have
simply been killed and many of them were they were often labeled as heretics because of this
you know for example a lot of modern christian groups today say that you know astral projection
is some kind of evil sin, but ask a gnostic and they will show you the bible and
tell you how it tells the reality of the astral and so part of being a gnostic is about studying
things objectively and considering all perspectives instead of only worshiping your own
opinions, your own personal preferences, your own interpretations of what is convenient to you
and your group and the people around you, and so since there is a lot of limited material for
gnostics much of their sects and groups and the knowledge within them were passed on by word of
mouth, and if you're wondering what kind of people we could call gnostics there are many and you know
it's something that is attained from within it's not limited to a certain type of people
you don't need to say "i believe in gnosticism" or "i am a gnostic" there are many in society that many
modern gnostics would easily call gnostic, and so we can learn how to recognize some gnostics by
understanding those who have contributed a great type of understanding through their diligent
works which are free from their own ego but strive toward a sincere heart to discover
universal truth - such people could be people like Gurdjieff, Jesus, Buddha, Muhammad, Nagarjuna, Leonardo da Vinci,
Paracelsus, Plato, Auspensky, Swami Sivananda, Lao Tzu, Hermes Trismegistus, the Dalai Lamas', and
many others... such people were concerned deeply and immersed in gnosis so much that they became famous
touched the hearts of many because they imparted information of universal lights that they found
internally and that people around them could not touch, they could not find this within themselves
they couldn't find that information easily through external means and all the while these
gnostics remained in complete humility, generosity, tolerance, and kindness for all people, for the
love of humanity and universal wisdom, they were not concerned with the image of themselves but
only of the teachings they had to share which they learned from within, hence as we'll see here these
positive and virtuous characteristics are crucial to have in order to know the truth yourself
and you know that's one reason i strive to limit my own personal life to not show my face,
not to express too much of my own personality and make it all about me and myself right? because the
core of these teachings, the core of awakening to find our inner gnosis is to know ourselves
not to know someone else or be fascinated with the personality of someone else there's no use
in such things it's a waste of time; know yourself and you will recognize whether you hear the truth
from others or not to know someone's face, background, ethnicity, religion, age, personal
history is not a way to judge the authority one has at all the authority is based on one's
level of consciousness that can only be recognized when we reach those levels within too
so the reason why we cannot truly define gnosis conceptually is found in the very meaning of it;
gnosis which is actually a greek word means "knowledge" but even then gnosis does not mean
knowledge it would be more accurate to call it "knowing" for what we mean by knowledge when we
say gnosis is absolutely not the same as what we conventionally understand as the word knowledge
conventional understanding of the word knowledge would be more accurately described as "memory"
in other words concepts ideas, theories, beliefs on the other hand gnosis means to be conscious,
cognizant, present of the direct reality of things deeper than the level of conceptualizations
it's a totally different type of knowledge a more direct knowledge whereas conventional knowledge
is only knowledge on an intellectual level gnosis means that "experience is better than belief"... direct
experience is absolutely superior to belief to experience the reality of something
implies that mere belief in that reality is no longer necessary - because you experienced it
you know it hence knowledge; gnosis, is when our intellectual instinctive
emotional minds are all in vibrant harmony with our direct experience to think you know something
is different from actually knowing it; one can think they know astral projection and another can
actually know it, so this is about knowledge we gain through our own experience rather
than things we're told, read, believe in and any other type of external psychological conditioning
and thus we could also describe gnosis as wisdom; a person can read every book there is
to read and not have a hint of wisdom right? actually if one isn't careful they may even
become less wise the more they read, and so in order to get to wisdom we
synthesize the four pillars of knowledge which are; science art religion and philosophy - together
through experience, these four pillars these four approaches, produce wisdom and a greater
understanding of every aspect of life in the four different dimensions that they can be comprehended
and experienced in; which are science art religion and philosophy -- to remove or separate any of those
dimensions of understanding is to not have a complete picture of reality; hence why Einstein
said and who you could very much call a gnostic in his approach to and in his personal life he said
"science without religion is lame, and religion without science is blind" now of course we're not
just talking about relying on modern science to make discoveries no we're talking about
real science within ourselves, and so a gnostic does not compartmentalize themselves into any one faith
religion or science but actively embraces them all to find a synthesis of understanding
accordingly a gnostic is able to humbly kneel at the church or temple of almost any religion
in order to seek understanding and in the deeper reality all religions came from gnosis
gnosis IS religion; it is that aspect within us that is the beginning of authentic religion
when i say "religion" your mind may bring images of church, temples, christianity but no that is not
explicitly religion; the meaning of religion comes from the latin word "Religare" which means "to bind",
"to connect the soul with consciousness", "with god", similarly "Yoga" means "union with the divine"
therefore in order for religion to manifest in the physical there must have first been 'active gnosis'
for any kind of religion to have been perceived in the first place
religion is just an interpretation of gnosis one interpretation all religions in their root
came from gnosis ~ gnosis is that spiritual 'root reality' gnosis is the foundation to every religion
or spiritual teaching and therefore recognizes the truth affinities and relationships within them all
from Osiris, Krishna, Jesus and, Zeus being symbols of the universal Christ, to Isis, Devi, Mary and Hera
as symbols of the Divine Mother; religious texts and symbolisms speak of the universal story of
spiritual truth and awakening hidden through the language of mystery and symbolism
and if you are guided properly to understand these things then it would suddenly become
very enlightening, rather than the unspecific ambiguities of most organized religions today
and without gnosis, religion becomes very difficult to understand
because we first must study the most direct and accessible thing there is; ourselves
and through studying ourselves then we can better understand the metaphors and archetypes of many
teachings as it says at the doorway of the Temple of Delphi: "Homo Nosce Te Ipsum" - Man Know Thyself,
and you shall know the universe and the Gods"... and so Gnosis is not limited to just the experience of
spirituality and the divine either; it is about the study of all aspects of life no matter what topic
you can apply Gnosis to it and understand it in a deeper dimension of consciousness... to a Gnostic
even the most mundane things have their meanings and purpose but the main thing to which we apply
gnosis to in order to empower our gnosis is ourselves; because this is where it derives from
and in understanding ourselves through direct experience we are also understanding nature
for we are a microcosmic reflection of the laws, science and art of everything that is around us
everything that is outside of us when i say nature i don't mean bushes trees and ants right i mean
nature with a capital n the divine and sublime intelligence that exists as this planet as our
human psychology, as the entire entity of our cosmos and its galaxies, as consciousness; this
is how gnosis becomes a direct study of science and not just belief to study oneself profoundly
scientifically, psychologically, is to also study nature and in the spirit and pursuit of science
a gnostic seeks to experiment experience and to see reality objectively ~ the hidden
purpose of all religion is to impart a psychological science the word psychology
derives from the Greek word "Psyche" which means "Soul"; thus every negative state of mind commonly or
somewhat wrongly called sin every type of this habit behavior unconsciousness or ego is liberated
through religion, is transmuted, is transcended and rebirthed into "light", into consciousness, or
in other words sin transforms into virtue and it's through this virtue that we begin to experience
gnosis more profoundly but remember that gnosis is not a compass of right or wrong it is not a rule
set a habit or behavior but a way to see reality and verify it for yourself, for example if you look
at your hands; now you can see and verify that you have hands and a physical body - that's is gnosis!
you know this ~ in order to verify you have a physical body you did not need to exercise your
"intellect" you exercised "awareness" yet this is only a small taste of gnosis this is just exercising
awareness in a very shallow superficial way so you know do you really know what your physical body is?
there are many names categorizations theories about the enigma and mystery of the physical body
and how it works, how it evolved, how it works, with consciousness but do you really know it? to really
know it would be a far more profound level of, gnosis if you knew what it was really capable of
of what it really implies in this existence that we call the universe... names and ideas fail
to express the ultimate truth and experience of things of our physical body and everything words
cannot express the truth of reality, and we should not get lost in them, and then what about if we
experiment with our awareness in certain ways in order to experience that which is beyond the five
senses and how do we know that what we are seeing is of the truth or not? and so gnosis becomes a way
to verify within ourselves through psychological science these things and you know for example to
say you see, hear, touch or taste something is one thing but to control it is something else as said
before gnosis is about science and experimentation therefore those things to which you can see can
you also control it? you may say "yes i can control my physical body" sure you can move it in certain
ways and use it to do things you desire but can you control it if someone insults you
or if you need to go to the bathroom or if you're extremely hungry what if you catch a cold and you
become moody and irritable, similarly can you control your thoughts or maintain awareness on
a specific thing without other thoughts coming in? we like to assume that we are in control of
our own lives but this is far from the truth and very difficult to understand if one is shrouded
in the assumptions, in the delusions, in the belief that we are in control; this belief is synonymous
with the ignorance of our own nature, and this very ignorance of our nature is what stops us
from seeing the total truth about things, as to be ignorant of what is within is also to be ignorant
of what is without; to say you 'know' something is to put a full stop on it right? period. done. but
this should not be the way we should only know a certain level a certain degree of something and
keep an open mind and continue our experimentation and our experiential knowledge of life
the purpose of gnosis and any spiritual tradition or religion is to gain back that control over
ourselves, otherwise we wouldn't be here studying all of this would we? we wouldn't be here if we had
perfect control over ourselves you know meditation, prayer, study and other spiritual practices would
not be required at all and what's one reason we don't know ourselves deeply? it's because
of the nature of our deluded minds or what you could call the "ego" -- the ego loves to categorize
to label, to dig its claws into ideas, mere ideas, of reality and identify with ones it likes for
its own intellectual satisfaction, perhaps to argue with others or just to be proud of some
beliefs, however this is where every scientist, religious, person, philosopher, artist all go wrong
if they only choose what their ego likes if one identifies with one side of a coin, with
one set of beliefs, with just one set of personal preferences, then they will feel in conflict and
argue against others who have opposing beliefs and not be able to see the total reality of
everyone - of anyone's beliefs no matter how dark or how light one may be, how positive or negative one
may be, you wouldn't be a gnostic then because a gnostic aims to help humanity help everyone...
but if you're only going to be in your own little corner with your own egoic preferences you are not
finding universal truth, and this is what gnostics mean by having the virtue, having the sacrifice
for humanity, and this is how it benefits us in return too by opening our mind to every
perspective of anyone on the planet, doesn't matter what they believe in what experience they have
no matter how bad or good we may think of them or what society thinks of them... so one aim of a gnostic
is not to get caught in this dualistic trap but to embrace universal polarities, to understand
each end of a pole and to seek to understand the hidden relationships and implications between
contradictions, it's to understand both the darkness and the light in order to gain a higher
degree of gnosis, if you don't understand something if you think something is confusing you or
creates a reaction within you an egoic reaction then there is light to be found in that darkness
and so in order to understand this light and dark we also have to understand those forces of
light and dark within ourselves too, reality is multi-dimensional; multi-dimensionality implies
paradox and to comprehend these paradoxes is to awaken different dimensions of consciousness,
different dimensions of understanding, within ourselves we are not just one sphere; we are many
spheres - infinite spheres of understanding, to be in opposition to be in an argument with someone
means that you are limited in your own spheres of understanding, but of course
as i said we have the ego, and it's very hard for the ego to humble itself, to be sincere, to put
itself in other people's shoes and truly empathize because we like to talk badly of other people
and we lack this kindness which is at the core of every teaching of religion and spirituality
to be kind is not just to be a good person, no, to be kind opens your heart to the greater reality
to find your inner gnosis, it is a science - kindness is a science, and that is not taught
in almost any spiritual teaching or religion that you commonly see today
so we don't need to think about gnosis or gnosticism in a way that we judge it
and say "oh maybe i should identify with this or not"... "perhaps i like this or not" no,
gnosis is an inner reality, an aspect of life the connection to the divine spark we all have within
thus gnosis teaches us that we shouldn't just assign ourselves to one teaching, resource or
religion just because we like this or that, or just because it satisfies our ego but instead we should
take an objective and fair approach to all things, to consider all things - in its practical heights
the purpose of gnosis is to radically transform what Christians call "the Soul" or what Buddhists
call "the Mind" and to do this Gnosis is a method to attain discipline, uprightness and true
inner tranquility beyond what you could ever think tranquility is, and through all of this
comes the gradual awakening of consciousness, through all of this comes the gradual liberation
of different egoic psychological parts of our ego that is trapping our consciousness in the darkness
we do not attain this by relying on anyone, any group, any religion, we may use
some groups, some religions but we do not rely on them everything is up to us nobody else we become
a responsible human being instead of blaming our problems on external things or other people
so to take this path gnosis teaches us that we first have to recognize our mistakes
that is; how we mistakenly see the world but this is hard to admit for most people right? so we also
need to go through the pain of confession to ourselves through the virtue of honesty - we have
to become deeply honest people that doesn't mean we just tell the truth to people but we
have to see and be honest within ourselves, with ourselves from moment to moment; we have to avoid
the sin of lying to ourselves of lying about reality to ourselves remember that "sin" is not
meant to be a bad thing sin translates as "to miss" or "to make an error", when we lie to ourselves we
convince ourselves of a deluded reality; a flawed perception, that we're so egoically firm about
especially if someone argues with us, thus only when we see that we are living in our own matrix
will we then choose to go beyond it but this takes a firm decision from the individual and many are
eager to awaken fast but it's a mistake to also think that we can change overnight, you might have
some very quick and profound bursts of spiritual awakening, but everything takes time, maturity
a gradual opening of our energetic being, if you look in nature everything takes time, patience we
have to tend to our inner self plant seeds, water ourselves, make sure we receive sunlight so to
transform the mind takes conscious and upright efforts and infinite patience... so you see the
power of gnosis now and how through understanding this deeper more authentic aspect and approach of
spirituality we can embrace all teachings from all religions and if you do and you understand
how to interpret them and take teachings from Christianity, Catholicism, Buddhism, Hinduism
Islam, and incorporate them into your daily life you will make huge leaps in your progression
you may notice if you go to a Christian mass there are some wonderful things said in the Bible but
nobody is taught how to meditate so then you go to a Buddhist temple you will find clearer teachings
on the mind and if you go to a Hindu temple you will find more mystical teachings etc etc
as said by Samael Aun Weor; "All religions are like precious pearls strung on the golden thread of
divinity"... and remember that intellectual conceptual understanding of these religions is one thing,
but the experiential and practical applications of such teachings from moment to moment in life
distills this knowledge into experiential knowledge; "Gnosis", one type of knowledge is
of the head the other is of the heart, hence gnosis is an emotional wisdom we feel it
rather than think it, all the divine teachings are essentially a map of consciousness
but yes this can be seen as a lot to take in a lot to learn but even more difficult
is continuous moment-to-moment practice and so to give an example of how we may apply this
experiential emotional gnosis we have to get in touch with our own emotional wisdom and combine it
with objective intellectual analysis, for instance you'll notice if you pay attention in your actions
you may notice certain behaviors you do in your life are wrong if you are honest with
yourself not because you believe it's morally wrong but you FEEL that you shouldn't be doing
what you're doing so how do you know if it's really wrong and not just based off what you think
it's based off what you FEEL -- and this is intuition although a very shallow form of intuition but it
is intuition nonetheless and thus when we FEEL this do we continue in ignorance and separate
ourselves further from consciousness? or do we learn to listen to our intuition
and strengthen this connection to intuitive knowledge by understanding what is right by
actively listening to our own conscience to our own feelings; when we strengthen such a connection
we can apply it to many things but it takes a lot of practice because right now we're in a state of
madness a state of impurities, so this emotional intuitive intelligence is something that can be
a little difficult to understand at first because just like how our minds are tainted
with the impurities of delusions and beliefs so too are our emotional centers; our emotional
brain you could say is tainted with moods, anger, depression, frustrations, fears, anxieties
hence the immediate need and importance to overcome suffering -- when we overcome suffering we
develop superior emotion in other words intuitive intelligent emotion; it is clear it is untainted by
our suffering, by our ego; and in many ways it is far more efficient than the intellectual mind
but this takes a lot of practice and so we have to escape our own suffering, not "escapism" but simply
"escape" out of the prison of our minds the prison that we have created for ourselves
not just created but you know we are the prison we are the cause of our own prison
and so if we want to experience reality we must leave our delusions of reality behind
because our delusions cause suffering and prevent us from seeing the truth
therefore we must study the facts of ourselves and take actions to chisel away and perfect
our masonic stone in other words the teaching of Freemasonry is to create a perfectly cubic stone
for when we begin on this path we are a gross undefined messy stone we need to chisel and hammer
to constantly perfect ourselves, and eventually we rise in degrees of awareness, we start to
attain real inner purity, inner tranquility, and we also attain mental and emotional equilibrium;
equanimity, thus we become less concerned about WHAT to think and act like but HOW to think
and act; the human vehicle including the soul is a cosmic instrument for deep intuitive knowledge
and we attain such an ability through cleansing our thoughts, our minds, our emotions, and our deeds
and this has to be done in a very conscious and deliberate way a fundamental message from
gnosticism is that we can in fact DO something about our darkness and in many of us we know in
our conscience, deep down inside, we KNOW, we can sense, that we CAN do something about it; there's
always steps, there's always something that our conscience is telling us what the right thing is
to do and if you have the courage to follow that then the path starts to become gradually clear and
so Gnosis is about ACTUALLY doing something about our darkness practically about this situation in
which we are suffering, and gnosis teaches us that God is not just some strange far-off ruler who's
judging us but that God is an extremely divine and complex intelligence within us all; real religion
is not about making yourself feel shameful, following some pastor or to only have faith and no
experience, real religion is the realization of the divinity within each and every person and living
being; Gnostics are sort of religious rebels who go against the contemporaries of conventional wisdom,
their illuminative creative outbursts come from their everyday experience of the divine
how else was the light carried through the ages? through organized religion? through superficial
spiritual movements? through government? no the light was always held by the Gnostics, by 'Gnosis';
they knew that all the heavens, all the Gods, all the divine wisdom, is within us, so are you a Gnostic?
I'm sure you are if you stayed with me throughout all of this! Thank you to these Gnostics: Kenneth,
Sheehan, Evie, and Jason for becoming Patreons and supporting the work that I do ~ if you'd like to
support as well just see the Patreon link down below, and if you know anything about Gnosticism too
feel free to share below, of course there are infinite things that i have not been able
to cover in this episode, and there are many interpretations and different sects and periods in
history that can all be appreciated and if you'd like me to cover any aspects of those just let me
know and I'll add it to the episode list, okay so this is Gene and I'll see you on the next episode
